name: q16_4
probTex: Let $\gamma(t)=e^{it}$ for $0\leq t\leq2\pi$. Evaluate\n\[\int_\gamma\ln\left(\frac{z-2i}{z+2i}\right)dz.\]\nYou will need to specify your branch of log.
solnTex:
We want to see where $\gamma$ goes under the Mobius transformation $ rac{z-2i}{z+2i}$. To do this, map a few points. $\gamma$ follows $1\mapsto i\mapsto-1\mapsto-i\mapsto1$, this becomes
\[- rac{3}{5}- rac{4}{5}i\mapsto- rac{1}{3}\mapsto- rac{3}{5}+ rac{4}{5}i\mapsto-3\mapsto- rac{3}{5}- rac{4}{5}i\]
Note the pole occurs at $-2i$, outside the region encircled by $\gamma$.
Regardless of our branch of log, it will always be holomorphic if it can be defined. If we define our branch of log for $	heta\in(0,2\pi)$ then our branch is defined on the interior of the image of $\gamma$, so by Cauchy's integral theorem the integral vanishes.
